newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian railways ministry says no 1997 Eurobond.
newsitem.headline: Russian railways ministry says no 1997 Eurobond.

text.p: The Russian Ministry of Railways has dropped plans to issue a Eurobond this year, Nikolai Aksenenko, recently appointed railways minister, said on Friday.

"There was talk (of a Eurobond this year) and there were attempts...but our position now is...to get to grips with our internal economy and find our own internal reserves to allow us to resolve our tasks," Aksenenko said.
"It seems that this will not happen this year."
He did not rule out the possibility that the ministry would issue Eurobonds in the future to raise money for investment projects, but he did not say when that would be.
